bestBHT.bht: Those who claim to know God yet live in disobedience are liars. The truth is absent in them as they futilely pretend to have knowledge of God while failing to keep His commandments. True knowledge of God is revealed through obedience, for love towards Him reflects His love towards His children. John exposes the empty claims of those who profess to know God but do not uphold His commandments. Such individuals lack the indwelling truth and deny God through their actions, as they fail to let the truth of grace lead them to obedience.

Henry Alford: The man saying, I have the knowledge of Him and not keeping His commandments, is a liar."
The futility of pretending to the knowledge of God where this test is not fulfilled.
In this man the truth is not.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: have knowledge of (perfect) Him." Compare with this verse
Albert Barnes: He that saith, I know Him...and keepeth not his commandments...is a liar."
He who professes to be acquainted with the Saviour...who does not obey him.
Such a profession is a falsehood...where one does not obey the law of God.
Marvin Vincent: He who claims to know God, yet lives in disobedience, is a liar.
The obedient child of God is characterized...merely as the subject of the work of divine love : as the sphere in which that love accomplishes its perfect work.
The love which God has, is revealed as the love of God in the love of His children towards Him, no less than in His manifestations of love to them.
John Calvin: He that saith, I know him...even by the contrary effect...the knowledge of God is efficacious.
For God is not known by a naked imagination, since he reveals himself inwardly to our hearts by the Spirit.
The Apostle charges all such with falsehood; for what he says would be superfluous, were there no false and vain profession of Christianity made by man.
Philip Schaff: He that saith, I know him...and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him."
He lies, and is without the indwelling truth, who, professing to know God in His Son, obeys Him not.
Archibald T. Robertson: The one who keeps on saying: 'I have come to know him,' and keeps on not keeping his commandments is a liar" (ψευστης, just like Satan, John 8:44 and like 1 John 1:8; 1 John 1:10).
John punctures such bubbles with the sharp addition 'and keepeth not' (ο μη τηρων, present active linear participle).
There is a whip-cracker effect in John's words.
John Gill: He that saith I know him... is a liar.
for though in words he professes to know God, in works he denies him.
the truth of grace... lead[s] persons to obedience.

bhtAttempts.bht: The man who claims to have knowledge of God but does not keep His commandments is a liar. This futile pretense of knowing God is a falsehood, as the truth does not dwell within him. Those who truly know and love God are characterized by their obedience to Him, for the love of God is revealed in the love of His children towards Him. John sharply punctures the bubbles of those who make empty claims of knowing God but do not keep His commandments. Such individuals are liars, lacking the indwelling truth and denying God through their actions. The truth of grace leads people to obedience, for God reveals Himself inwardly to our hearts by the Spirit, not through superficial professions of faith.

Those who claim to know God yet live in disobedience are liars. The truth is absent in them as they futilely pretend to have knowledge of God while failing to keep His commandments. True knowledge of God is revealed through obedience, for love towards Him reflects His love towards His children. John exposes the empty claims of those who profess to know God but do not uphold His commandments. Such individuals lack the indwelling truth and deny God through their actions, as they fail to let the truth of grace lead them to obedience.

Those who profess knowledge of God yet disregard His commandments are liars, lacking the truth within them. To claim familiarity with God while living in disobedience is to engage in futile pretense. In contrast, true knowledge of God is exemplified through obedience, as His love is manifested through the love of His obedient children. John exposes the emptiness of those who make empty claims of knowing God but fail to live according to His commands. Such individuals deny God through their actions, for the reality of grace leads to a life of obedience.

One cannot truthfully say they know God if they do not keep His commandments. Such claims are falsehoods, lacking the indwelling truth. True knowledge of God is revealed through obedience, as His love is shown in the love of His obedient children towards Him. Those who make empty declarations of knowing God but do not adhere to His commandments are liars, denying God through their actions. The truth of grace leads individuals towards obedience, as God reveals Himself inwardly to our hearts by the Spirit.

A person who claims to know God but fails to obey His commandments is a liar. This pretense of knowledge is futile, as the truth does not reside within them. True knowledge of God is evidenced by obedience, for His love is made known through the love shown by His children. John clearly confronts those who make empty boasts of knowing God while disregarding His commands. Such individuals lack the truth and contradict their claims through their actions. Genuine knowledge of God leads to obedience, as He reveals Himself inwardly to our hearts by His Spirit.
